comments:
Yesterday: no problem.
Today morning, i try to compare a local file with the CVS remote file, i get that. I try to synchronize, and i get the same exception. What is going on?

Error 2006-06-08 10:10:47.926 An internal error occurred during: "Synchronizing CVS (/MyProject)".

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/team/internal/ccvs/core/client/Command$1
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Command.execute(Command.java:300)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Version.execute(Version.java:89)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Session.open(Session.java:188)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.fetchDelta(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:188)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.buildTree(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:156)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.buildRemoteTree(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:139)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.CVSWorkspaceRoot.getRemoteTree(CVSWorkspaceRoot.java:180)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSResourceVariantTree.fetchVariant(CVSResourceVariantTree.java:80)
at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.AbstractResourceVariantTree.refresh(AbstractResourceVariantTree.java:86)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSResourceVariantTree.refresh(CVSResourceVariantTree.java:327)

at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.refresh(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:160)
at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.refresh(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:125)

eclipse.buildId=M20050929-0840
java.version=1.4.2_10
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=fr_FR
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86

This seems like a classloader issue. Does restarting Eclipse fix the problem?

Moving to Runtime.

no, restarting didn't change anything

(In reply to comment #1)
> This seems like a classloader issue. Does restarting Eclipse fix the problem?
> 
> Moving to Runtime.
>
It looks like if your install has been corrupted. Could you delete your install folder and reinstall eclipse?
i've extracted agin the tar.gz file, overwriting old files, and it works. How could this happen? I hope it doesn't come from my hard disk.
This is strange. If you were not playing with re-exporting the team plug-in, I would consider checking my disk. Good luck.
